meanings.definition: A condition in which one sense is simultaneously perceived as if by one or more additional senses.
meanings.sent1: Her synesthesia allowed her to taste colors and see sounds.
meanings.sent2: The artist experienced synesthesia, hearing music as bursts of color.
meanings.sent3: During the concert, his synesthesia made him believe the music was painting the walls.
meanings.sent4: The synesthesia of the forest enveloped her, turning the rustling leaves into whispers of color.
meanings.sent5: His synesthesia was like a magical kaleidoscope, blending all his senses into a symphony of experiences.

meanings.definition: The production of a sense impression relating to one sense or part of the body by stimulation of another sense or part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The synesthesia of feeling a tickle when seeing someone scratch their head fascinated her.
meanings.sent2: His synesthesia caused him to smell flowers when he heard a certain melody.
meanings.sent3: The chef's synesthesia led to a hilarious mix-up when he tasted colors instead of flavors.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the synesthesia of touch and taste created a symphony of sensations.
meanings.sent5: The synesthesia of the ocean breeze against his skin painted a picture of serenity in his mind.
